column4: Hi all, I have a school windows environment and am running a pilot Ubuntu program. I am still using Windows DNS. My Ubuntu machines are not showing any entries in the DNS. Strangely, my windows machines can ping them via hostname, but Ubuntu machines cannot (except where the ubuntu machine being pinged has a fixed IP). I'd be really grateful for any help. Ping will not resolve either the simple host name or the fqdn. Thanks
if you run:  cat /etc/resolv.conf    are your DNS servers listed?
how about if you run:  nslookup name    where name is another ubuntu system?
use nslookup and you will see the method used :)
